item.title: Primary School
item.description: The aim of the project is to separate staff and student circulation. The brief needed a primary school in Birkenhead, Merseyside capable of catering for six school years. The main challenge was fitting the accommodation schedule on such a small site of 198 sq.m. The design approach was to create a mountain where the classrooms and additional accommodation was staggered around a central hall space. Access for students and parents would be externally through a terrace with staff entering through the main building itself.

item.title: Film School
item.description: The aim of my project is to create a film hub on campus that links the south west side with current and future hotspots across the university. It will be a mixed-use sustainable building that provides private and well thought out spaces for film teaching and development whilst also hosting public meeting areas and events. The design is based around the relationship between the studio and cinema boxes. The workshops, control rooms and teaching spaces serve the studio space and there is a visual awareness between the production (studio) and viewing (cinema) Heat recovery and rainwater collection systems ensure the building is sustainable.

item.title: Co-living Residential Project
item.description: The aim of the project is to create a mixed use building with clear boundaries between private and public spaces.
